titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Vernon-Benshoff Company Records, 1911-1972 AIS.1972.06
titlestmt.author: Chris Liggitt. Revisions occurred to the finding aid as a part of the encoding process on June 4, 2003.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-07-08 17:14:18 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: The Vernon-Benshoff Company was established by Harold and Lester Vernon, along with their partner, William Benshoff, in 1922. The Company records include tapes and transcripts of the history of the company, details about the development of the dental base Vernonite, alloy specifications for the casting metals, business accounts and correspondence, legal papers, various price lists, photographs, memorabilia, some outside publications, and The Vernonite Work Bench.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: The Vernon Gold and Refining Company was chartered to Harold and Lester Vernon on December 15, 1915 in Pittsburgh. Most of their metal refining was for the purpose of making dental supplies. When a bank coalition forced the brothers out of business in 1922, they established, with William C. Benshoff as a partner, the Vernon-Benshoff Company in 1923. The company developed various casting metals, including "Chilcast," a dental base made of monomeric and polymeric methacrylic resins, a process of imbedding objects in acrylic for decorative purposes, and material for orthopedic appliances. The company continued after Mr. Benshoff died in 1935. Around 1945, the Vernon brothers were involved in the trial of the DuPont and Rohm Haas companies, which were charged with forming a cartel; eventually the charges against the Vernon brothers were dropped. Lester retired in 1955, but Harold continued to act as a research consultant for the company until 1962. The Vernon-Benshoff Company became a subsidiary of C. M. P. Industries, Inc., of Albany, New York in 1972.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Records of the Vernon-Benshoff Company are arranged into ten series: History, Technical papers, Price Lists, Contracts and Legal Papers, Accounting Records, Correspondence, Publications, Memorabilia, Photographs, and Miscellaneous Writings. These records include tapes and transcripts of the history of the company, details about the development of the dental base Vernonite, alloy specifications for the casting metals, business accounts and correspondence, legal papers, various price lists, photographs, memorabilia, some outside publications, and The Vernonite Work Bench. Complete series descriptions are included before each series listing.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of Harold Mark Vernon on June 14, 1972.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Vernon-Benshoff Company Records, 1911-1972, AIS.1972.06, Archives & Special Collections, University of Pittsburgh Library System

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was processed by Chris Liggitt in 1972.

Revision and rearrangement for the encoded version of the finding aid provided by Michele Tourney in 2003. Information about the collection title and the controlled access terms was extracted from the MARC record in the University of Pittsburgh catalog Voyager ID number: 1426864.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: Permission for publication is given on behalf of the University of Pittsburgh as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission of the copyright holder, which must also be obtained.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Series I is comprised of four audio cassette tapes and three folders of transcripts. The tapes, which are housed in a folder at the beginning of Box 1, contain recordings of interviews with Harold and Lester Vernon regarding the history of their companies; the folders contain transcripts of these interviews. The Vernons discuss the founding of their companies, former employees, the Vernonite process, and key events in the history of Pittsburgh. The audiotapes are arranged in order from 1 to 4, and the transcipts are arranged within folders in the same order. Folder 3 contains the transcripts of interviews for which there is no corresponding audiotape.

did.unittitle: Typed transcript of interviews on tapes 1-3
Typed transcript of interviews on tape 4

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Series II contains reports and notes on the testing and physical properties of certain alloys. These materials include a notebook compiled by Harold M. Vernon, papers describing alloys used by Vernon-Benshoff and its competitors, reports, and reprints from the Journal of American Dental Association. The materials in this series are arranged chronologically and then alphabetically within the folder.

did.unittitle: Papers on the physical properties of alloys
Reports on techniques used by other companies

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Series III contains lists of various alloys from 1928 to 1950. The lists are arranged chronologically within the folder.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Series IV is comprised of legal materials pertaining to the Vernon-Benshoff Company and its practice. The first folder contains contracts with the Rohm Haas Company and the University of Illinois's College of Dentistry for the study of the resilient synthetic resins. The second folder contains subpoenas related to the U.S. District Court case with the Rohm Haas Company. The materials are arranged chronologically by folder.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Series V contains financial materials created in the course of business of the Vernon-Benshoff Company. These materials include various accounts, a ledger book, statistical data on dividends, securities, and number of employees and payroll, profit and loss statements, and miscellaneous items pertaining to insurance policies, vouchers, and securities. Except for the miscellaneous items, all materials in this series are arranged chronologically. The ledger contained in Folder 12 was kept by Emma Thoma until William Benshoff became a partner, at which time he began to record stock information in the ledger.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Series VI includes letters received from DuPont, Main and Company (accountants), and dentists using Vernon-Benshoff products. The materials are housed in one folder and are arranged alphabetically by correspondent.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Series VII is divided into three subseries, Publications by Vernon-Benshoff Company, Publications about Vernon-Benshoff Company, and Publications on techniques used by other companies. The first subseries contains promotional pamphlets created by the company as well as a run of The Vernonite Work Bench, a monthly publication produced by Vernon-Benshoff which reported on company research. The publication lasted until 1950, when budgetary constraints caused its suspension. The materials in this subseries are arranged chronologically. The second subseries contains articles and reprints from Modern Plastics and Rohm Haas Reporter on Vernon-Benshoff products such as methacrylate resins and other acrylics. The materials in this subseries are arranged chronologically as well. The third subseries consists of reprints from the Journal of American Dentistry which describe research conducted by other companies in the area of dental practices and products. These reprints are arranged chrnologically.

did.unittitle: Reprints--"Embedded in Acrylic," from Modern Plastics and "Captured in Castings," from Rohm Hass Reporter
Publications on techniques used by other companies
Reprints from Journal of American Dental Association

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Series VIII contains a variety of materials which include a safety record certificate, "Camcar Camara" with a picture of embedded acrylic decorating the lobby of Camcar Screw Mfg. Corporation, and a death announcement for employee William E. Williams.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Series IX, Photographs, contains numerous photographs arranged according to subject matter. The first grouping includes images of laboratory equipment, manufacturing and packaging activities, and microscope photographs of alloys. Another group consists of interior and exterior shots of the Vernon-Benshoff Company, while a third includes employees, conventions, and demonstrations. The final group contains photographs of objects in acrylic.

did.unittitle: Laboratory equipment, manufacturing and packaging, microscope photos of alloys
Interiors and exteriors of Vernon-Benshoff Company

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Series X includes various parables, verbal sketches, etc., written by Harold M. Vernon from 1970 to approximately 1972.
